workflow.name: Automate WordPress Elementor lead management with Excel CRM & email campaigns
workflow.description:
Description

This workflow automates lead collection from WordPress Elementor Forms, stores form submissions in an Excel/Google Sheet CRM, sends emails to both admin and the customer, and also performs recurring promotional email campaigns.

Ideal for anyone using:
Elementor Pro Form Widget
Elementor-based WordPress websites
Webhook-enabled contact forms
This system replaces multiple plugins and services (Mailchimp, CRM plugins) with a simple, fully automated workflow.

üåê **What This Template Does**
üü¶ 1. Captures Elementor Form Submissions

The workflow starts with a Webhook Trigger connected to your Elementor form‚Äôs ‚ÄúWebhook‚Äù action.

It collects:
Name
Email
WhatsApp number
Budget
Project details
Any custom field from Elementor

üü© 2. Saves Each Lead to Excel / Google Sheets

Using the Sheets/Excel node, every form submission is stored as a new row in your CRM sheet.

This helps you maintain:
Lead database
Contact history
Budget details
Customer inquiry info

üüß 3. Sends Notification Email to the Website Owner

A Gmail node sends a fully formatted email to the site admin with all submission details.

Useful for:
Quick follow-up
Lead tracking
Team notifications

üü® 4. Sends Auto-Reply Email to Customer

A thank-you / confirmation email is automatically sent to the customer who submitted the Elementor form.

This creates:
Professional communication
Instant acknowledgment
Trust and credibility

üü´ 5. Updates Excel Sheet with Email Status

After sending each email (admin & customer), an update is written back to the Excel sheet:

‚ÄúOwner Mail Sent: YES‚Äù
‚ÄúCustomer Mail Sent: YES‚Äù
or error logs if needed.
This allows full auditability.

üü£ 6. Scheduled Marketing Email Campaigns

A Schedule Trigger (daily/weekly/monthly) runs your promotional email batch.

It:

Reads email list from your Excel/Sheet
Loops through each row
Sends email using Gmail node
Logs ‚ÄúCampaign Email Sent‚Äù for each contact
This gives you a built-in email marketing engine using your CRM sheet as a source.

üü§ 7. Loop + Gmail Email Sender

The workflow loops over each row and sends individual emails instead of bulk mailing.

Benefits:
Higher inbox delivery
Less spam detection
Personalized messaging

üõ†Ô∏è Use Cases

Elementor Pro Form submissions
WordPress business or agency website
Auto CRM creation in Excel/Google Sheets
Auto-responses for submitted forms
Monthly email campaigns
Lead database + tracking
Replace Mailchimp or CRM plugins

üöÄ Features

100% No-code
Works with Elementor Pro Webhook
Easy to customize
Full automation chain
Reliable email notifications
Marketing-ready system

üìù Tags

#wordpress #elementor #form #automation #webhook #excel #googlesheets
#crm #leadmanagement #emailautomation #gmail #marketing #promotion
#autoresponder #webflow #website #automation

parameters.subject: Send mail to Owner

parameters.content:
# How it works
### This workflow captures Elementor form submissions using a webhook, saves each lead into an Excel/Google Sheet CRM, and sends two emails‚Äîone to the website owner and one to the customer. It also includes a scheduled email campaign that sends promotional messages to all contacts stored in the sheet. The flow combines real-time lead processing with recurring marketing automation.

# Setup steps

#### 1. Add the webhook URL inside your Elementor form‚Äôs/others form Webhook Action.

#### 2. Connect your Google Sheets/Excel credentials and set the correct sheet/tab.

#### 3. Configure both Gmail nodes with your own email account.

#### 4. Update the sheet column names if needed (Send Sucessfully.).

#### 5. Adjust the email content templates to match your brand.

#### 6.Set your preferred schedule (daily/weekly/monthly) in the Schedule Trigger node.

## STEP 1: üü¶ Webhook Input and Store Lead in Sheet

###  1. Receives form data from Elementor. Collects fields such as name, email, phone, message, etc. This is the entry point of the workflow.
###  2. Adds each submission to your Excel/Google Sheet CRM. Creates a new row for every lead with all collected details.

## STEP 2:  üü©  Notify Website Owner and Auto-Reply to Customer

###  1. Sends an email to the admin. Includes lead details to enable quick manual follow-up.
###  2. Sends a confirmation email to the user. Acknowledges the form submission and sets expectations.

## STEP 3:   üüß Status Update in Sheet

###  Writes ‚ÄúMail Sent‚Äù updates back to the sheet. Useful for tracking what emails were successfully sent.

## STEP 4: üü¶ Scheduled Campaign Sender

### Reads all emails from the sheet and sends marketing messages. Runs on a schedule using the Schedule Trigger and Loop.

## STEP 5: üü¶ Send promotional email 

###  Can customize the email and sent email all the email listed in the excel sheet

user.name: Didarul Hhossain
user.bio: I am a WordPress developer specializing in custom website design and user-friendly layouts. I also integrate CRM systems and automation workflows using n8n, helping businesses streamline lead management, email campaigns, and data-driven processes. I combine creative design with powerful automation to deliver websites that are not only visually appealing but also operationally efficient.
